results.title: The Port mob
results.creator_credit: Edwin Whiting, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Edwin Whiting speaks fondly of his time when he and his mates had the run of Port Melbourne in the 1930s. They spent most of their spare time together, but World War II changed everything.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edwin Whiting, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Edwin Whiting speaks fondly of his time when he and his mates had the run of Port Melbourne in the 1930s. They spent most of their spare time together, but World War II changed everything.

results.title: Coming home
results.creator_credit: Louise Blake, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Despite being born in Canberra, Louise Blake’s family history has very strong ties to Melbourne. Over the years, family trips have drawn Blake ‘south of the border’, where suburbs like Port Melbourne and Brunswick evoke stories from her family history.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Louise Blake, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Tumanu's people
results.creator_credit: John Morris, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Documents Commonwealth Government assistance to the Aboriginal people of the Northern Territory in 1960. Shows the contrast between the old aboriginal way of life, which is gone for ever and the new. Stresses the progress made over recent years, the difficulties of older people adjusting to big changes and how the children will be those to enjoy the new life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Morris, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.description: Documents Commonwealth Government assistance to the Aboriginal people of the Northern Territory in 1960. Stresses the progress made over recent years, the difficulties of older people adjusting to big changes and how the children will be those to enjoy the new life.

results.title: Why plant millions of trees
results.creator_credit: Alfred Zerfas, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Alfred Zerfas gives background to and outlines the achievements of Social Education and Development Society (SEDS). This organisation was started in the 1980s in response to the crushing effects of drought in Southern India. With persistance over the decades, the work of SEDS, in collaboration with the communities they support, has brought about economic, social and enviromental change in these communities with lasting benefits.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Alfred Zerfas, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Princes Street Port Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Lyn McLeavy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A tribute to a suburb, a family and a lady who liked to play the piano and sing the blues. Lyn McLeavey describes growing up in Port Melbourne in the 1950s, blending in the harsh realities of life as the daughter of a traumatised ‘wharfie’, with the simple joy of the sounds of the streets.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lyn McLeavy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: A tribute to a suburb, a family and a lady who liked to play the piano and sing the blues. results.title: Like mother...like daughter
results.creator_credit: Christine Lamb, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Christine Lamb is constantly told how much she’s like her mother. It is through looking back on her life and all the things her mother taught her, that Lamb learns how similar they really are.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Christine Lamb, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Unwise and foolish creations of fancy
results.creator_credit: Sally McCutcheon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Sally McCutcheon tells her story, threaded together by her two life-long passions, dancing and beading. Through determination, discipline and the support of her family, McCutcheon has managed to excel at both at different stages of her life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sally McCutcheon, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Art 4 Starts
results.creator_credit: Sonya Waters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sonya Waters, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.
description_for_label: What other people consider vandalism or graffiti, Sonya Waters sees as street art. Behind the work, Waters recognises the skill and social commentary inherent in the work and seeks to help the artists, often kids from disadvantaged backgrounds, recognise the artistic and social value of their work and become empowered by it.

results.title: Digital Storytelling workshop : general public (March 2007)
results.creator_credit: Sue Silk, Sonya Waters, Sally McCutcheon, Martin Zerfas, Lyn McLeavy, Louise Blake, Llywellyn Staiff, Joyce Evans, Edwin Whiting, Christine Lamb, Alfred Zerfas, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eleven stories from members of the general public. Mostly autobiographical, they are stories that concern themselves mostly with the passions of the creator, whether social issues, history, hobbies or family. These passions and interests are what makes the participants who they are.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sue Silk, Sonya Waters, Sally McCutcheon, Martin Zerfas, Lyn McLeavy, Louise Blake, Llywellyn Staiff, Joyce Evans, Edwin Whiting, Christine Lamb, Alfred Zerfas, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
